verses.kjv: Then came all the tribes of Israel to David unto Hebron, and spake, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
verses.web: Then all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron, and spoke, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.
verses.ct: All the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and said, "Look, we are your own flesh and blood.

verses.kjv: Also in time past, when Saul was king over us, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the LORD said to thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be a captain over Israel.
verses.web: In times past, when Saul was king over us, it was you who led Israel out and in. LORD said to you, ‘You will be shepherd of my people Israel, and you will be prince over Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: Even back when Saul was king, you were the one actually leading Israel's armies in and out of battle. And the LORD told you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will be their ruler.'"

verses.kjv: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and king David made a league with them in Hebron before the LORD: and they anointed David king over Israel.
verses.web: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron, and king David made a covenant with them in Hebron before LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel.
verses.ct: So all the elders of Israel came to King David at Hebron, and he made a covenant with them there before the LORD. Then they anointed David king over all Israel.

verses.kjv: David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years.
verses.web: David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years.
verses.ct: David was 30 years old when he became king, and he reigned for 40 years.

verses.kjv: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years over all Israel and Judah.
verses.web: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months; and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years over all Israel and Judah.
verses.ct: He ruled over Judah from Hebron for 7 years and 6 months, and then he ruled over all Israel and Judah from Jerusalem for 33 years.

verses.kjv: And the king and his men went to Jerusalem unto the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land: which spake unto David, saying, Except thou take away the blind and the lame, thou shalt not come in hither: thinking, David cannot come in hither.
verses.web: The king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spoke to David, saying, “The blind and the lame will keep you out of here;” thinking, “David can’t come in here.”
verses.ct: David and his men marched to Jerusalem to attack the Jebusites who lived there. The Jebusites taunted him, saying, "Even the blind and the lame could keep you out!" They were convinced David could never break through.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless David took the strong hold of Zion: the same is the city of David.
verses.web: Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion. This is David’s city.
verses.ct: But David captured the fortress of Zion — which became known as the City of David.

verses.kjv: And David said on that day, Whosoever getteth up to the gutter, and smiteth the Jebusites, and the lame and the blind, that are hated of David’s soul, he shall be chief and captain. Wherefore they said, The blind and the lame shall not come into the house.
verses.web: David said on that day, “Whoever strikes the Jebusites, let him go up to the watercourse and strike those lame and blind, who are hated by David’s soul.” Therefore they say, “The blind and the lame can’t come into the house.”
verses.ct: That day David declared, "Whoever attacks the Jebusites, let him go up through the water shaft and strike down those 'lame and blind' that David despises — and he'll be made commander." That's why people say, "The blind and the lame will not enter the house."

verses.kjv: So David dwelt in the fort, and called it the city of David. And David built round about from Millo and inward.
verses.web: David lived in the stronghold, and called it David’s city. David built around from Millo and inward.
verses.ct: David moved into the fortress and named it the City of David. He then built up the area all around it, from the Millo inward.

verses.kjv: And David went on, and grew great, and the LORD God of hosts was with him.
verses.web: David grew greater and greater; for LORD, the God of Armies, was with him.
verses.ct: David kept growing more and more powerful, because the LORD God of hosts was with him.

verses.kjv: And Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and masons: and they built David an house.
verses.web: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, with cedar trees, carpenters, and masons; and they built David a house.
verses.ct: King Hiram of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, carpenters, and stonemasons. They built a palace for David.

verses.kjv: And David perceived that the LORD had established him king over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom for his people Israel’s sake.
verses.web: David perceived that LORD had established him king over Israel, and that he had exalted his kingdom for his people Israel’s sake.
verses.ct: David recognized that the LORD had firmly established him as king over Israel and had elevated his kingdom for the sake of his people Israel.

verses.kjv: And David took him more concubines and wives out of Jerusalem, after he was come from Hebron: and there were yet sons and daughters born to David.
verses.web: David took more concubines and wives for himself out of Jerusalem, after he had come from Hebron; and more sons and daughters were born to David.
verses.ct: After moving from Hebron, David took more wives and concubines in Jerusalem, and more sons and daughters were born to him.

verses.kjv: And these be the names of those that were born unto him in Jerusalem; Shammuah, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon,
verses.web: These are the names of those who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
verses.ct: These are the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

verses.kjv: Ibhar also, and Elishua, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
verses.web: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.ct: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia,

verses.kjv: And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphalet.
verses.web: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.ct: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphalet.

verses.kjv: But when the Philistines heard that they had anointed David king over Israel, all the Philistines came up to seek David; and David heard of it, and went down to the hold.
verses.web: When the Philistines heard that they had anointed David king over Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David, but David heard about it and went down to the stronghold.
verses.ct: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel, their entire army mobilized to hunt him down. David got word of it and retreated to the stronghold.

verses.kjv: The Philistines also came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.web: Now the Philistines had come and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: The Philistines arrived and spread out across the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And David enquired of the LORD, saying, Shall I go up to the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into mine hand? And the LORD said unto David, Go up: for I will doubtless deliver the Philistines into thine hand.
verses.web: David inquired of LORD, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hand?” LORD said to David, “Go up; for I will certainly deliver the Philistines into your hand.”
verses.ct: David asked the LORD, "Should I attack the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?" The LORD answered, "Go! I will absolutely deliver the Philistines into your hands."

verses.kjv: And David came to Baalperazim, and David smote them there, and said, The LORD hath broken forth upon mine enemies before me, as the breach of waters. Therefore he called the name of that place Baalperazim.
verses.web: David came to Baal Perazim, and David struck them there. Then he said, “LORD has broken my enemies before me, like the breach of waters.” Therefore he called the name of that place Baal Perazim.
verses.ct: David went to Baalperazim and defeated them there. He said, "The LORD has burst through my enemies in front of me like a flood breaking through a dam!" That's why the place was named Baalperazim.

verses.kjv: And there they left their images, and David and his men burned them.
verses.web: They left their images there; and David and his men took them away.
verses.ct: The Philistines abandoned their idols there, and David and his men carried them off and burned them.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines came up yet again, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.web: The Philistines came up yet again, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: But the Philistines came back again and spread out across the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And when David enquired of the LORD, he said, Thou shalt not go up; but fetch a compass behind them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.
verses.web: When David inquired of LORD, he said, “You shall not go up. Circle around behind them, and attack them in front of the mulberry trees.
verses.ct: David asked the LORD again, and this time the LORD said, "Don't attack head-on. Circle around behind them and come at them from the direction of the mulberry trees.

verses.kjv: And let it be, when thou hearest the sound of a going in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shalt bestir thyself: for then shall the LORD go out before thee, to smite the host of the Philistines.
verses.web: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, then stir yourself up; for then LORD has gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”
verses.ct: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, move quickly — because that will mean the LORD has gone ahead of you to strike down the Philistine army."

verses.kjv: And David did so, as the LORD had commanded him; and smote the Philistines from Geba until thou come to Gazer.
verses.web: David did so, as LORD commanded him, and struck the Philistines all the way from Geba to Gezer.
verses.ct: David did exactly what the LORD commanded, and he struck down the Philistines all the way from Geba to Gezer.
